title: La Liga exploring Barcelona-Real Madrid switch leaves El Clasico an unwitting pawn amid Spanish unrest
text:
It is the organisation that so often does the bidding of its two biggest clubs, although Wednesday was a rare occasion when Spain’s Liga achieved the very rarely possible: it united Barcelona and Real Madrid, in opposition to one of its worst ideas.

That was moving the Clasico game on Oct 26 and it came at the suggestion of the Liga executive and its president, Javier Tebas, the kind of football administrator who likes the sound of his voice so much he probably thinks he could sell his personal broadcast rights. Both Real and Barcelona have rejected the notion that the match should be switched from the Nou Camp to the Bernabeu and when you follow the trail that got them to that conclusion, it...
